definition: ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly

sentences.english: Militant mineworkers in the Ukraine have voted for a one-day stoppage next month.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰激进的矿工们已经投票决定下个月罢工一天。

sentences.english: Shasta, we took a vote and decided to help you start a dogsled team.
sentences.chinese: 我们投票决定帮你组织一支雪橇队。

sentences.english: The company voted to enfranchise its 120 women members.
sentences.chinese: 公司投票决定给予其120名女职员选举权。

sentences.english: A few days later, citizens voted to take measures to re-develop the canal system.
sentences.chinese: 几天之后，市民们投票决定采取措施恢复运河系统。

sentences.english: Mineworkers in the Ukraine have voted for a one-day stoppage next month.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰矿工们已投票决定下个月罢工一天。

sentences.english: But later in the day the trustees voted to fire him.
sentences.chinese: 但当天晚些时候，学校董事会理事投票决定解雇他。

sentences.english: Final adoption of the plan requires a second vote by the five-member commission.
sentences.chinese: 计划的最终通过需要5人委员会的第二次投票决定。

definition: competitive election (i.e. with more candidates than seats)
non-competitive election (i.e. with as many candidates as there are seats)/single-candidate election
to read ballot slips out loud
public decision (by ballot)/majority decision/a joint decision/referendum
(of a document) not bearing a name/unregistered (financial securities etc)/bearer (bond)/secret (ballot etc)/anonymous/unattributed (remarks)/(of a check) payable to the bearer
proposal/draft resolution/motion (to be debated)/to propose a bill/to make a proposal
